home.metaDescription: A 24/7 live AI meditation mentor in your pocket: solo or collective sits, co-watching educational videos, reading meditation books together, and reflective practice conversations. Apply to join the pilot.

hero.headline: Let’s make practice easier to return to.
hero.subheadline: Stillpoint is a 24/7 live AI meditation mentor you can access through an app—sit alone or with others, keep a steady rhythm, learn from videos and books, and talk through what’s happening in your practice.
hero.note: Pilot program. Calm pace. Limited places.

features.heading: A practice container you can actually return to.
features.intro: If you already meditate, you know the hard part isn’t information—it’s continuity. Stillpoint is built around returning: to the seat, to attention, and to honest reflection.

items.title: Co-presence sitting (not another guided track)
items.description: Start a sit anytime with a steady companion presence. Keep it fully silent or request minimal prompts. The focus is practice—not entertainment.

items.title: Gentle accountability that respects real life
items.description: Set a rhythm you can keep. When you miss a day, return cleanly—without guilt. Stillpoint helps you reduce friction and maintain the thread.

items.title: Collective sessions with other practitioners
items.description: Join shared sits across the day: a brief opening, a timed sit, and optional reflection afterwards. Enough social gravity to show up, without performance pressure.

items.title: Reflective conversation after the sit
items.description: Review what actually happened: distraction patterns, effort balance, posture, mood, and habit loops. Then choose one small adjustment for the next sit.

items.title: Learn alongside practice (videos + books)
items.description: Co-watch educational videos and co-read meditation books with the mentor. Extract practical takeaways and translate them into concrete practice experiments.

steps.title: Download and set your rhythm
steps.description: Choose a pace you can sustain—short or long sits, solo or collective. Stillpoint is designed for continuity, not intensity.

steps.title: Sit (solo or together), anytime
steps.description: The mentor is live 24/7. Start a session whenever you want, or join scheduled group sits that run throughout the day.

steps.title: Reflect, learn, and adjust
steps.description: Do a short post-sit reflection, then optionally watch a video or review a book section together. Convert insights into one testable change for your next sit.

newsletter.heading: Apply to join the pilot
newsletter.text: Stillpoint is currently running as a small, careful pilot. Apply to join—or subscribe for updates on cohorts, collective sessions, and release timing.
newsletter.privacy: No spam. Occasional updates only. Unsubscribe anytime.
newsletter.consent: By subscribing, you agree to receive emails about Stillpoint. You can unsubscribe at any time.

items.a: A 24/7 live AI meditation mentor you access through an app: solo or group sits, reflective practice conversations, and learning through videos and books translated into practice.
Not therapy, not medical advice, not a crisis service, and not a replacement for a human teacher. It’s a practice-support environment.
Light to medium practitioners who already meditate and want steadier continuity, clearer reflection, and optional shared sessions.

items.q: How does the AI help during practice?
items.a: It can keep time, offer minimal prompts if you want them, and help you reflect after sits—focused on practical adjustments rather than grand claims.
Yes. The mentor is available any time. Collective sessions run across the day and expand as the community grows.
We aim for minimal data collection. Email subscribers can unsubscribe anytime. Any deeper privacy policy details can be linked once published.
Pricing is to be confirmed. The pilot is small so we can learn what support is genuinely useful and sustainable.

contact.headline: Let’s plan your next sit.
contact.subheadline: Share a few details and we’ll respond with suggested times, session formats, and study options.
